research_findings.finding: Student attention drops significantly after 15-20 minutes without intervention
research_findings.source: Cognitive Load Theory - Sweller et al.
research_findings.recommendation: Break lessons into 15-minute segments with active learning transitions

research_findings.finding: Teachers should ask 15-20 questions per 45-minute class for optimal engagement
research_findings.recommendation: Ask mix of recall (40%), comprehension (30%), and higher-order (30%) questions

research_findings.finding: Waiting 3-5 seconds after asking a question increases quality of responses by 400%
research_findings.recommendation: Implement structured wait time: 3-5 seconds after question, 3 seconds after response

research_findings.finding: Active learning increases retention by 50% compared to passive lectures
research_findings.recommendation: Spend 60% of class time on active learning activities

research_findings.finding: Immediate feedback is 3x more effective than delayed feedback
research_findings.recommendation: Provide feedback within same class session, ideally within 5 minutes

research_findings.finding: Optimal teacher-student talk ratio is 30:70 for maximum learning
research_findings.recommendation: Teacher talks 30% of time, students talk/work 70% of time

research_findings.finding: Using 3+ modalities (visual, auditory, kinesthetic) improves retention by 65%
research_findings.recommendation: Incorporate visuals, audio, text, and hands-on activities in every lesson

research_findings.finding: Students retain 90% of what they teach to others
research_findings.recommendation: Include peer teaching activities in 30% of lessons

research_findings.finding: Positive emotional climate increases learning by 40%
research_findings.recommendation: Start with positive greeting, use encouraging language, celebrate effort

research_findings.finding: Presenting too much information at once reduces retention by 50%
research_findings.recommendation: Chunk information into 3-5 main points per segment, use scaffolding
